concepts.name: Algebraic Expressions
concepts.description: Understanding and manipulating variable expressions, including evaluating them for given variable values.

concepts.name: Substitution
concepts.description: Replacing variables in an expression or equation with specific numerical values to simplify or solve.

concepts.name: Order of Operations
concepts.description: A standard sequence (PEMDAS: Parentheses, Exponents, Multiplication and Division, Addition and Subtraction) to evaluate expressions consistently.

concepts.name: Exponents
concepts.description: Expressions involving repeated multiplication, such as powers, and their evaluation.

concepts.name: Equations and Inequalities
concepts.description: Solving mathematical statements involving equality (=) or inequality (<, >, ≤, ≥).

concepts.name: Functions
concepts.description: Relationships between inputs and outputs, described using equations, tables, or graphs, and understanding domains and ranges.

concepts.name: Graphing Functions
concepts.description: Representing functions visually on a coordinate plane and analyzing their behavior.

concepts.name: Problem-Solving Strategies
concepts.description: Using systematic approaches like writing equations, making tables, and checking results to solve real-world problems.

concepts.name: Real-World Applications
concepts.description: Using algebra to model and solve practical problems, such as calculating costs, interpreting graphs, or determining rates.

concepts.name: Linear Relationships
concepts.description: Understanding and solving problems involving proportional changes or constant rates of change.
